title: How China is trying to force Trump to back down, even if it means making trade concessions
summary: Beijing has reiterated that it is not engaging in direct discussions with the US government. Both countries are taking measures to try to limit the impact of the prohibitive tariffs by excluding certain products.

title: No place for racism in France, says Macron after worshiper stabbed to death in mosque
summary: The attacker, on the run since Friday's attack, stabbed the worshiper dozens of times and then filmed him while shouting insults at Islam in a village in southern France.

title: Liverpool smash Tottenham to win English Premier League title
summary: The Merseyside club was crowned Premier League champion on Sunday after a 5-1 win against Tottenham. Liverpool's record-equaling 20th English league title matched the achievement of its great rival Manchester United.

title: The crucial role of architecture in urban rehabilitation
summary: Architects should no longer be excluded from old building rehabilitation projects, as they are both artists of transformation and the guardians of urban harmony, writes Le Monde journalist Isabelle Regnier.

title: When sharks bite in self-defense
summary: An analysis of bites inflicted by sharks in French Polynesia suggests that, in 5% of cases, they are a defensive reaction toward humans.

title: Rekindled love: 'Back then, in 1986, we had neither the grammar nor the vocabulary of a homosexual relationship'
summary: They met, fell in love and separated. And then the whirl of life brought them back together. Thorsten, 58, shares his story with Pascal, who, in February, told 'Le Monde' his version of their reunion.

title: Israel's Netanyahu calls for 'dismantling' Iran's nuclear infrastructure
summary: In a speech in Jerusalem on Sunday, the Israeli prime minister insisted that any deal with Tehran must also address its ballistic missile capabilities.

title: 'The Church is us': Hundreds of thousands attend pope's funeral at the Vatican
summary: Pope Francis was laid to rest in the Basilica of St. Mary Major in Rome on Saturday after a funeral mass at St. Peter's Square. The ceremony was attended by dozens of monarchs and heads of state, along with an immense crowd of faithful, paying tribute to a pope who was close to the people.

title: Firefighters fight to put out blaze after Iran port explosion leaves at least 40 dead
summary: More than a thousand people were also injured after a massive explosion ripped through Iran's largest commercial port on Saturday.

title: Is it ever a good idea to… wear cowboy boots?
summary: In fashion as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.

title: North Korea's diplomacy of 'survival'
summary: Despite severe United Nations sanctions and deep isolation, Pyongyang remains a significant player on the international geopolitical stage. Its leaders skillfully exploit global crises, supported by experienced diplomats.

title: At least 11 killed after car driven into Vancouver street festival crowd
summary: A car plowed into a crowd celebrating the Filipino holiday of Lapu Lapu Day on Saturday night. The driver has been taken into custody.

title: With Starlink, Musk extends his grip on the world – and space
summary: Bolstered by its technological superiority, the billionaire's company has become indispensable, particularly for Ukraine. Donald Trump's close associate now holds unprecedented levers of influence, raising questions of a conflict of interest as China seeks to catch up.

title: Aid workers sound the alarm over Gaza's transformation into 'mass grave'
summary: Since March 2, Israel's complete blockade risks turning the Gaza Strip into a 'mass grave,' according to humanitarian workers who are increasingly threatened on the ground, writes historian Jean-Pierre Filiu in his column.

title: In Tunisia, Kais Saied's headlong rush toward autocracy
summary: A sham trial resulting in the conviction of some 40 critics, with sentences reaching up to 66 years in prison, illustrates the repressive escalation that has gripped the birthplace of the Arab Spring since 2021.

title: Canada's Arctic territory is increasingly vulnerable to external threats
summary: Due to Donald Trump's unpredictability and Russia and China's ambitions, Canadian researchers and intelligence agents agree Canada must reinforce its Arctic strategy or risk losing control of a significant portion of its territory.

title: Napoleon letter denying he ordered pope kidnapping sells at Paris auction
summary: The hand-written letter from Napoleon rejecting his role in the kidnapping of Pope Pius VII in 1809 sold for €26,360 at an auction on Sunday.

title: Ethiopia's Assefa breaks world record to win London marathon, Kenya's Sawe wins men's race
summary: Tigst Assefa made up for coming second in last year's marathon to coast home in the women's London Marathon in a world record time of 2hr 15min 50sec on Sunday. Kenya's Sabastian Sawe won the men's London marathon in a time of 2hr 02min 27sec.

title: In Huntington Beach, California, the 'MAGA-nificent 7' are all-powerful
summary: The Southern California seaside city has become a kind of laboratory for triumphant Trumpism. The city council's elected officials, all Republicans, have issued a flurry of decisions touching more on subjects of national controversy than on local issues.
